concept.title: Instance Log In Without a Password

conbody.p: Log in access to a running instance is typically accomplished, or least affected by, by public/private key authentication. The problem with including a root (Linux) or Administrator (Windows) password in an EMI is that all users who deploy an instance from that EMI would receive the same administrative password. The result is that one user would know the administrative password for another user's instance. For this reason, the EMIs do not typically include any passwords for the administrative account (root or Administrator). The use of public/private key pairs for each user eliminates the need to include a root or Administrator password in the EMI.
